In this paragraph, the only entity that clearly refers to a chemical is the "Y-MRS total score," which is a rating scale used to assess the severity of symptoms in patients with psychiatric disorders, such as depression and schizophrenia. It is important to note that the Y-MRS total score itself is not a chemical substance, but rather a measure used to evaluate the chemical imbalances in the brain that may contribute to psychiatric disorders.
